description: Conversion of single warehousing unit into two separate units (B8 use class); associated internal and external alterations; and associated parking and refuse storage
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.    REASON In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers Ordnance Survey Plan; 1430.2.01 Rev A; 1430.2.02 Rev A; 1430.2.03 Rev A; and 1430.2.04.   		REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interest of proper planning | Prior to occupation an integrated servicing management plan for all of the proposed units hereby approved shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval. The approved servicing management plan shall be implemented prior to occupation and retained thereafter.    REASON: To ensure that the impacts of the development do not adversely impact the safety, capacity and flow of the transport network in accordance with policy 6.3 of the London Plan (2015). | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the main building.     REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2014); and policies 7.4 and 7B of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The car parking spaces shown on drawing number 1430.2.04 shall be marked out on the site prior to first use of the development. These spaces shall be kept continuously available and shall not be used for any other purpose.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate parking provision within the site, in accordance with policies 6.3 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2015). | Covered and secure cycle parking for seven cycles as shown on drawing number 1430.2.04 shall be in place prior to first use of the development hereby permitted and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for cycle parking.   REASON: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with Policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2015). | Refuse storage as indicated on drawing number 1430.2.04 and in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority, shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.	  REASON:  To ensure that suitable and accessible refuse storage facilities are provided and in the interests of the visual and general amenities of the area, in accordance with policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2015). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, as amended by the Town and country Planning (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) (No. 2) (England) Order 2008, the premises shall only be used for uses within the  B Use Class and not for any other use.   REASON: To protect the character and amenity of the area and to safeguard Strategic Industrial Land in accordance with policies 4A, 7A, 7.4, 7B and 6.13 of the Development Management DPD (2013); policies 1.2(b) and 3.2 of the Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies 2.17 and 6.1 of The London Plan (2015).
